pages.text: The Nuclear Reactor generates Zaps by burning $(l:ftbic:generators/nuclear/fuel)Uranium Fuel Rods$(). As they are burned, they create Zaps, but also $(c)Heat$().$(br2)If Heat reaches 10,000, the Reactor will explode. The faster it was heating (heat/s), the bigger the explosion.$(br2)Heat is generated at the end of every second, rather than every tick.
A 42 block radius explosion, from a Reactor with 16 Quad Fuel Cells and no coolant.
pages.title: Reactor Meltdown

pages.text: $(item)Reinforced Stone$() is $(l)VERY$() resistant to explosions, including those from the Wither, Ender Dragon, and even Nuclear meltdowns!$(br2)Also comes in $(item)Reinforced Glass$() form, which functions identically.

Heat in the Reactor works on a grid-based system. Each slot can interact with the 4 slots it touches.$(br2)As a Fuel Rod generates heat, it will see if an adjacent item can absorb it. If it can, it does so. If there isn't one, the Reactor itself heats up.$(br2)This is what causes explosion and whatnot, so try to avoid that.
pages.title: Heat Distribution
The Simplest Reactor
pages.text: Since they are touching, the $(l:ftbic:generators/nuclear/sus)Heat Vent$() can absorb the Heat from the Fuel Rod.
